result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny A Olea was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Danny A Olea is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Danny A Olea was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danny A Olea

Ct.1 - Dismissed  kmk
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Danny A Olea, appeared with Attorney Cassi Baumgardner.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Count 1-  Dismissed by the State.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 6 months with conditions. Cash Bond on deposit to be applied to any costs and remaining balance to be paid during supervision.   Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.
filed by Atty Cassi Baumgardner

No violent contact with victim J.N.  Amended bond signed by def. in court.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  Jury status hearing 3/24/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial 3/28/16 at 8:30.  Defense bond motion heard re no contact with victim.  Court modifies condition to no violent contact with victim J.M.  Other conditions of bond remain the same.

  Special Prosecutor Attorney Daniel Tombasco  appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.
